message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public void deleteStudent(int studentID){
    Iterator<Student> iter = students.iterator();
    while (iter.hasNext()){
        Student ob = iter.next();
        if (ob.getStudentID() == studentID){
            iter.remove();
            break;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The ConcurrentModificationException is thrown when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it using an Iterator, in a way that is not allowed by the Iterator. In your case, you are trying to remove an element from the list while iterating over it. To avoid this, you should use the Iterator's own remove method, which safely removes the current element from the list. Also, make sure to initialize the iterator inside the method where you are using it.
